Talon/Windlord

Talon slowly walked towars Tucson=E2=80=99s quarterts and s=
he glenty hit the door, and waited for Tucson.


**************************=
*************************************

Windlord started laught for a while =
then he regain composture and scream in ultrasonic way trying to scare of t=
he wild horses.




From: Sandy Panico 
Sent: Wednesday, July 06, 2011 10:1=
7 PM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Subject: Re: Changing times (Cue: All Maxi=
mals & Autobots)




Ooc: gotchya.

BIC:

Tucson nods and turns to get read=
y for a little alone time with Talon.

Yet he turns back to Wheelie.

" If =
that's what you want, that's fine by me, Wheelie.  But keep in mind, it doe=
sn't hurt to have a friend as well as a comrade by your side. I learned tha=
t many vorns ago when I started working with the Autobots.  And yes war is =
a difficult time and we can not weaken our defenses but, it doesn't mean we=
 have to be anti social either.  Strength is in numbers.  That was one of M=
aster Yokitron's words."

Tucson backs into his private quarters and closes=
 the door softly.

Perpetually on the move and constantly busy. 

On Jul 6,=
 2011, at 10:20 PM, "adamsafran" <adamsafran@...> wrote:


    

  > =

  > Meanwhile, in Tucson's quarters, Tucson looks down at Wheelie and real=
izes that he had no idea of his change of status, seeing that the last time=
 they were together Tucson was just an average comrade, just a slight large=
r than Wheelie. He heaves a sigh and kneels down to Wheelie.
  > 
  > " I w=
as going to give you a lecture and a warning but I realize you just comebac=
k online after many vorns . You were not aware of my change of status to Pr=
ime office and perhaps mistook me for my previous status. I'll let it go th=
is one time, Wheelie but keep in mind that a Prime is a Prime no matter who=
 they are. All right, you're free to roam the Auto base now. Please try not=
 to get sent to my office again, okay?"
  > 
  > With a smile of understand=
ing, Tucson opens the door to let Wheelie go on his way. Once having let Wh=
eelie free, he waits for Talon with a light hearted smile on his face.
  > =


  OOC - Uhm, I posted Wheelie leaving your quarters and he never entered =
them in the first place, then him heading out. So there's no way he coudl h=
ave been there, and he wouldn't have gone back over to them! So will pose t=
his as taking place out in the ship corridors. Thanks!

  Also, I appreciat=
e your posting, but it's sort of weird how you have each and every characte=
r of your's coming up, then doing something to me, then knowing each and ev=
ery thing that happened to each adn every other one that did, and them all =
having the exact same opinions over on everyone as everyone else did. 

  A=
lso, unless your characte ris asuperior officer who's going to emphatically=
 order him to do something, please don't pose him going somewhere far else =
after you for a setup. Since it's hideously unrealistic for him to go back =
to Tuscon's quarters twice now as you've posed him doing when he's not espe=
cially fond of Tuscon, nor him following someone else as well when I posd h=
im trying to leave. So, if going to go somewhere with him, please give me a=
 cahnce to respond to it ahead of time. It's two times you posed him extens=
ively going with your characters when it was not in character for him to do=
 so.

  If your characters have had interactions with him in the past or th=
ings I should know of, let me know? As I have no idea where Wheelie interac=
ted with Tuscon or how they would have remotely konwn of one another, and y=
ou've posted repeaetdly that Tuscon knows him from the past, when I have no=
 idea of that.

  So again, if they've had interactions as NPC's, let me kn=
ow their generic history so I can respond appropriately. If he's going to b=
e told to go somewhere wtih someone, either give me a chance to respond app=
ropriately if he does or not, or make it something like a specific order in=
 the case someone is a superior. And it's also rather weird how your charac=
ers come up from nowhere, all have the exact same opininos and back one ano=
ther up to the hilt on thier interactions and everything. I feel kind of we=
dged into a corner by this.

  I understand I'm new to the gruop and you've=
 been here much longer, I just feel rather hemmed in on the character with =
what you're doing and am confused as to how things operate, and how you hav=
e all of your alts congregating and making me feel pressed into a corner.

=
  Anyways, sorry if this is coming fof a bit too negative, thank you very m=
uch for the welcome here and for playing wtih me and interacting with Wheel=
ie.

  <Back In Character>

  Wheelie, having met Tuscon up in the hall, ga=
zes over at him, "What is this with all of you? You're back and forth whate=
ver I do. This is what Prime is, just a rank? It seems like it's just sort =
of dank. We had four of five in a room, that's not a level of doom and gloo=
m."

  Then, walking away from Tuscon, but looking behind, "I'm glad you're=
 good with all of your friends, congrualtions on the promotion and to whate=
ver ends. But we, we were never friends. We went back and forth in our ways=
, and I respect your orders for these days. But we're not here to have fun,=
 we're here to fight and run and gun."

  Wheelie leaning against the wall,=
 "I'll work wtih you, if you do tell, but I'm a soldier, and war is hell. I=
'd prefer to keep my own advice, and I appreciate your friends, they try an=
d be nice. But don't have them ganging up on me and telling me what to do, =
or how you'll react, or on you'll I chew. So by al lmeans, give me some spa=
ce, we're here to fight for the future of our race."
